Why is High Hedge Law being used on SAME height for 20yr hedge? NO loss of enjoyment! Huge risk to hedges across uk! @MaryRobinson01 @RobertJenrick @mhclg @CommonsHCLG @TimesProperty https://t.co/am292f1r34 @HouseofCommons @GreenpeaceUK @ChrisPincher @campbellclaret @EnvAgency

urls.title: Hedge Law Madness; Privacy and Wildlife Warning to all! - Berwyn Business Services
urls.description: If you care about wildlife, your right to keep your privacy and you care for your garden, then this is a massive warning to you all! Our hedge that’s been the same height for over 20 years is facing a cut. This is because a neighbour opposite has abused the High Hedge Law (HHL) to get the council to put an order on it to be cut to a lower level, permanently despite nothing changing in two decades, and the complaint person provided NO loss of light, or any loss enjoyment! Our solicitor and local tree surgeons are shocked at this news and warn if lowered it will impact millions. If you don't support us that hedge in your street could be gone, so please read this and call/email your MP! Our Same height of 20yrs plus, yes keep saying that, is a same height so not changed, and so its impossible for it to now negatively impact anyone. Our solicitor says with no loss of enjoyment which was the basis of the complaint, and so they (compliant house) have no case, and the Council are vastly wrong
